title: Lionel Messi: Barcelona forward breaks Pele scoring record in win over Real Valladolid
description: Lionel Messi scores his 644th goal for Barcelona during his side's win over Real Valladolid to break Pele's record of the most goals for one club.

title: Sacking Arteta would be a big mistake - Guardiola
description: Pep Guardiola says it will be a "big mistake" if Arsenal sack boss Mikel Arteta after Manchester City's 4-1 win over the Gunners in the Carabao Cup.

title: Brexit: Will the borders be ready?
description: With less than two weeks until the end of transition, we look at the challenges to come at British borders.

title: Covid-19: Kindness spreads Christmas cheer across the UK
description: Many people have received good deeds from others to help them through the festive period this year.

title: Covid-19: Border disruption, calls to end UK travel bans and cases in Antarctica
description: Five things you need to know about the coronavirus pandemic this Tuesday evening.

title: Covid-19: Almost 3,000 lorries stuck in Kent as UK and France aim to restart freight
description: Politicians are in talks to resume freight, after France closed the border because of the new variant.

title: Murray continues promising form with Battle of the Brits win over Norrie
description: Andy Murray continues in promising form at the Battle of the Brits, beating Cameron Norrie in straight sets.

title: Coronavirus: EU urges countries to lift UK travel bans
description: Dozens of countries, alarmed by a new coronavirus variant, have suspended travel links with the UK.

title: Tesco reintroduces buying caps on some products
description: The move is to make sure all customers have access to the products, such as rice and eggs, it said.

title: EU and UK in 'final push' for post-Brexit trade deal
description: Talks are continuing in Brussels, with less than 10 days to go until the UK leaves EU trading rules.

title: Royal Mail ends two-year dispute with union in 'landmark' deal
description: The postal service agrees a deal with unions to end a bitter dispute over pay and conditions.

title: Covid: New variant found ‘due to hard work of UK scientists’
description: Similar new variants of the coronavirus may be circulating undetected around the world, scientists say.

title: Peter Cruddas: PM overrules watchdog with Tory donor peerage
description: Boris Johnson says former party treasurer Peter Cruddas has a "long track record" of political service.

title: Covid-19: Can face masks make communal singing safe enough?
description: Communal singing is against Covid guidelines in the UK but could a new scientific study change that?

title: Man Utd desperate to win a trophy - Solskjaer before Everton EFL Cup tie
description: Manchester United are "desperate to get our hands on a trophy", says boss Ole Gunnar Solskjaer before their EFL Cup quarter-final at Everton.

title: Heavyweight champion Joshua helps fund British amateur boxing
description: World heavyweight champion Anthony Joshua gives a six-figure sum to support amateur British boxing, the BBC understands.

title: 'Eating disorders don't take a break for Christmas'
description: With celebrations often focusing on food, how do you get through the festivities with an eating disorder?

title: Will pregnant women receive the Covid-19 vaccine? It depends
description: Without pregnant women in trials for the jab, countries are taking different approaches.

title: Giant iceberg A68a shatters into large fragments

title: Covid in Scotland: Scottish level four rules 'may be strengthened'
description: Nicola Sturgeon warns that the current top level of restrictions may need to be tightened further.

title: Covid-19: Stranded truckers worried they won't get home for Christmas
description: Truckers stranded in Kent for a second night talk of their fears of not getting home for Christmas.

title: Will schools be closed next term by variant of virus?
description: The new variant of coronavirus could overtake plans for returning to school in England next term.

title: Covid-19: UK sees over 80,000 excess deaths during pandemic
description: The UK is continuing to see more deaths than expected for this time of year, ONS data shows.

title: UK haulier ran Europe-wide drug ring from living room
description: Thomas Maher used an encrypted phone to arrange the movement of drugs and cash.

title: In pictures: Planets Jupiter and Saturn cross paths
description: Planets Jupiter and Saturn cross paths in the night sky, an event known as the great conjunction.

title: Fifa lodges criminal complaint against former president Blatter
description: Former Fifa president Sepp Blatter is accused of financial impropriety in relation to the Fifa museum project in Switzerland.

title: Ancient mummified wolf cub in Canada 'lived 56,000 years ago'
description: Scientists say the cub, which died about 56,000 years ago, is "the most complete wolf mummy known".

title: Concussion affects 20% of professional players in England
description: One in five professional rugby union players in England suffered concussion during the 2018-19 season, according to latest medical figures.

title: Covid: Seven ways to get through (and enjoy) Christmas on your own
description: Many of us have had to rip up our Christmas Day plans and for some that means spending it alone.

title: Thailand: Baby elephant in road accident saved by CPR
description: The animal was injured when it collided with a motorcycle while crossing the road in Thailand.

title: Paul Whelan: Grim life of US 'spy' in Russian labour camp
description: Paul Whelan was convicted as an American spy earlier this year and sentenced to 16 years in prison.

title: Tottenham: Why Harry Kane is the ultimate team player
description: Alan Shearer still sees Harry Kane as a goalscorer, but says it shows how good the England captain is that he is also a creator and defender for Tottenham.

title: Nick Butter: The man who ran a marathon in every country in the world
description: Nick Butter was 26 when inspiration came. He set out on a unique adventure but, despite two years' planning, wasn't ready for what came next.

title: Tanzania 'using Twitter's copyright policy to silence activists'

title: Charity single maker LadBaby aims for the Christmas number one for the third year running

title: 1,000 lost on one boat - this woman hopes to name them

description: From a potentially record-breaking electric plane, to new homeworking tech, what to watch out for in 2021.
